title: Monica Bellucci, 55, flashes her abs in a sheer corset for film event in Rome
text:
She is one of the most glamorous women in the world.

And Monica Bellucci looked absolutely phenomenal as she arrived to first Italian event of the Academy of Motion Pictures, Arts and Sciences at Barberini Palace in Rome, Italy on Tuesday night.

The actress, 55, set pulses racing in a sexy black bodice which flashed her toned abs thanks to its semi-sheer detailing.

Monica Bellucci, 55, looked phenomenal as she arrived to first Italian event of the Academy of Motion Pictures, Arts and Sciences at Barberini Palace in Rome, Italy on Tuesday

The plunging number put emphasis on her ample assets, and she teamed the look with a chic blazer and wide-leg trousers, complete with towering heels.

Monica's short brunette locks perfectly framed her youthful features which boasted a glamorous coat of make-up, while accessorising with dangling drop silver earrings.

The Spectre star completed the a-list look with a chic matching clutch.

The film star was seen without her man Nicolas Lefebvre, 36, who she has been believed to be dating since May 2017, four years after her split from ex-husband Vincent Cassell.

The actress first confirmed she was seeing someone in an interview with Paris Matchlast November, but stayed coy about her partner's identity.

Admitting they had been dating a while and things were going well, she said of her new man: 'The man I share my life with doesn't have the same job as me, but he travels a lot. His rhythm of life complements mine.'

Together: Monica posed with the CEO of Film Academy, Dawn Hudson

Asked whether she would consider getting married again, the former Bond girl kept her cards close to her chest.

She said: 'When you've been married twice before, you need to take time to think about it before starting over, to understand why it happened and why you divorced. Let's just say I'm in a learning phase at the moment.'

Monica was married to fashion photographer Claudio Carlos Basso from 1990 until 1994, and then Matrix star Vincent Cassel from 1999 until 2015.

Trio: They were also joined by President of the Film Academy David Rubin (L)
